OOC: 
Here we go again. Liek I said, this is just a very modified version 
=
of my previous post. Hopefully its a lil better at working my 
character en=
trance. Much as I liked the other post, this has to be 
done, if only to ma=
ke things better for the rest of you.

(IC)
   
The pod bore the heat of at=
mospheric entry like a champion, ripping 
through the thick prehistoric air=
 of the planet Earth. Carried inside 
the stasis pod's shell-like hull was =
a Maximal, stoic and courageous. 
He had been sent in the stasis pod to pro=
vide backup warriors to 
Maximal groups on the planet Earth, where advancin=
g Predacon warriors 
are making their collection gambit a reality.
   

It =
came in low, lower than the computers of Cybertron had predicted. 
On its c=
urrent path it was headed for a rocky section of land, near 
what seemed to=
 be a large settlement of some sort. The reading 
blinked up against perpet=
ual-thrust boosters of the pod, a relatively 
older model. It was too late =
for stopping procedures. The pod was 
certain to crash into a thick rock fa=
ce, a facet of a plateau. As the 
reverse thrusters ignited as they were au=
tomated to do, the pod fell 
into a spiralling tumble, uncontrolled and fas=
t. The shuttlecraft's 
computers began to malfunction, hard. One by one, in=
 rapid 
succession, the pod's systems went awry. The boosters, the 
navigat=
ion, the communication, even certain life support systems for 
the spark of=
 the Maximal. The scanners of the vehicle exploded to 
life amongst the ter=
rible disconnections of systems, and the sensory 
orb was launched from the=
 rear of the pod.
    

The small orb was released from a hatch that slid o=
pen. It flew 
upwards, and two small metallic wings flipped out. It fell to=
 the 
earth below incredibly quickly. It crashed into the soft ground of a =

watering hole. The orb began lifting upwards, out of the water, and 
power=
ing up. Most of the suite was busted, very little or the device 
was intact=
 or working. What was operational was the uplink to the 
still-falling stas=
is pod, and a very weak power core. It was about to 
die and leave the prot=
oform inside the stasis pod stranded. 
   

At that moment, a herd of eleph=
ants shot by in a stampede towards a 
watering hole. Caught in the scanner =
beam of the orb, a male bull 
elephant was passed over by a small yellow li=
ght. The orb's network 
to the pod which still tumbled across the Africa-As=
ia regions of 
prehistoric Earth activated and immediately beamed the DNA d=
ata to 
the protoform itself, bypassing the computer systems. The robot 
in=
side still lived.
   

Inside the pod, a rapid transformation took place. T=
he transformer's 
body was melded in a slick metallic form of beast and mac=
hine. Many 
minutes passed as the pod shot into a rock face in Asia. The di=
rect 
uplink had gone straight into the robot. It hadn't been done before. =

Who was to know if the former Autobot would emerge deranged, 
deformed, or=
 whether he would even emerge at all. Almost thirty 
minutes passed as the =
protoform to shape and did its best to filter 
out many unnecessary things.=
 
  

 And then an eruption of fire exploded forth in a shower of energy 
a=
nd stone chips. A lone robot stood in a carved out section of the 
rock pla=
teau, twin ion cannons in hand. With suddenness belying his 
large size, th=
e bot shifted to beast mode with a spoken command. His 
body formed that of=
 a huge grey elephant, and the large beast made 
his way down the newly for=
med hill of rock. Lost in thought as he 
climbed down carefully, the Maxima=
l beast was amazed at the immediate 
qualities of his transformations, rapi=
d and unstrained. The 
transformer's amazing switch to robot mode was a cur=
iosity even to 
the seasoned former Autobot. He shouldn't have been able to=
 switch so 
quickly after gaining a beast mode to his protoform, but in fac=
t, he 
did. 
   

Chalking it up to his age and stubbornness, for now at le=
ast, he 
continued down the crushed rock pathway he'd created out of the 
s=
hattered stone leveled by his ion cannons. He hopped from on large 
piece t=
o another at one point, and it seemed the impact shifted the 
rock. It slid=
 off its little crutch of stone and slid the rest of the 
way down.
   

"C=
onvenient."
   

Looking up and around, and marveled at the beauty of this =
small 
world. The Decepticon and Predacon forces on this world were going t=
o 
destroy it if left alone. He couldn't let that happen, in his mind. 
As =
soon as he found his commanding officer, a computer, and the 
mysteries of =
his change came a little closer to being solved, he 
would eliminate as man=
y as possible. 
 

Only a half mile away, visible to the silvery savanna an=
imal, was the 
Autobot base. Running towards it at full speed, he made a be=
eline for 
the island stronghold. It would be up to him to discover what th=
e 
base was and who ran it. If it was Autobot or Maximal, maybe he could 
f=
ind help. If it was Predacon or Decepticon=85 well, Skullhammer would 
inde=
ed get to test out his robot form again.
